page.title: 04Modern day farming
page.content: We interviewed Mrs. Speed at Beer Hall Farm. She told us about modern farming. Nowadays they use tractors and ploughs and have a lorry coming every day to collect the milk and take it away.In the olden days the farmer would milk the cows by hand, rather than machinery, put it into churns and take the churns to the nearest village to sell. Now the cows are milked by machines and the milk goes into jars, then a big milk lorry comes to the farm to collect the milk. The milk is taken to a bottling depot and then delivered to us by the milkman. Mr and Mrs Perry also have mainly grazing land on which they keep mainly cows but also a few sheep. The cows are Friesians and have a milk yield of about 1000 gallons per cow per year.
